text:
When Lea Michele appeared on Watch What Happens With Andy Cohen, it didn't take long before she touched upon Glee. A caller asked the singer and actress which episodes of the popular show had been her favorite — and least favorite — to film, and the star responded with some behind-the-scenes scoop.



"My favorite episode to shoot was the first time we ever went to New York, so I think it was the last episode of Season 1," she revealed. "It was so fun, coming from New York and then getting to go back to my hometown." As for her least favorite episode, here's a hint: Thriller.

"The Michael Jackson episode was really hard to shoot," the actress spilled. "I think we felt a lot of pressure to make it super great, and to recreate a lot of those numbers. I think that was just because we wanted it to be so good. And I think at 4 a.m. one [morning] Amber [Patrice Riley] and I walked off set because we were so tired."

Lea Michele also opened up about one of her famous co-stars. A caller reminded the actress that she'd kissed John Stamos on Scream Queens, and asked exactly how good that kiss was. Watch the clip above to get the lowdown on "kissing Uncle Jesse."
title: Lea Michele Reveals The Glee Episode That Made Her Walk Off Set

meta_data.title: Lea Michele Spills Secrets About 'Glee' and John Stamos  | The Daily Dish
